text:
I recently noticed that there are various JavaScript-based syntax hightlighting
tools around. Here's a screenshot how CodePress (http://codepress.org, LGPL)
looks with the OneForm editor. Unfortunately CodePress has no explicit XML
support, but apparently HTML works fine for the XHTML resource type.

The Google syntaxhighlighter (http://code.google.com/p/syntaxhighlighter/) has
support for XML and XSLT (maybe we could even make our XSLTs conveniently
editable in the browser).
creator: andreas@apache.org

CodePress support for OneForm editor

The patch enables CodePress support for the OneForm editor. The "insert
link/image/asset" buttons had to be disabled because the CodePress script
manipulates the DOM of the page and the buttons don't work anymore.
